revised_title: Eel-Back Dun Horse Markings and Zebra-Quagga Distinctions
tldr: The author examines the markings of the Eel-back Dun variety of horses in Scotland and compares them to the markings of zebras. They note that the cross bar markings on the legs are not found in the quagga, which is a distinct species from the zebra. This observation challenges the conclusions drawn in Lord Morton's paper on the subject.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior and Genetics
